ratings.rComments: The class material is so easy, and depending on your TA the assignments are very easy as well.  Dr. Zola is an awful professor.  He will email you if you miss one class about lack of participation and threaten to fail you, and if you email back he will never respond.  Not all of his assignments are in the syllabus and your TA won't know about them.
Passionate teacher and wonderful human being. However, in his epsy 201 course I didn't take away much as far as content. I would say this course is geared more towards "life lessons."

I would have dropped this class if it wasn't for our separate TA-led discussion. Zola calls you out if you are taking notes  (really?!) and he can't get through 50% of his slides almost every week. He doesn't know what is planned for day. Some people enjoyed his antics but I felt really uncomfortable. He makes you "talk to your neighbor" too much.

You have to go to all the lectures, the second lecture that Zola doesn't teach is boring but you can do your homework for the class in it. Easy to get away with not reading the book. Group tests as long as you go to class. He tries to make class interesting by acting/skits, dressing up, and bringing kids in.
Great teacher. Made me cry my last day of class.
Fun and enjoyable class but you absolutely learn the lessons from the course.
One of the best
Class was EXTREMELY easy. You barely need to know basic psychology and even that is pushing it. T.A's are awesome. Pretty much you won't learn anything though.
He is the best teacher I have had at this university.  He is the most passionate man about his career that I have ever met in my life.  It really got me motivated to become the best teacher I can be.
What a great guy! Definitely recommend taking his class.

This man is very passionate about education,but I'm pretty sure he's trying to weed us out through his class.After the first exam,which was hell on paper,I said it was way too stressful and awful and he replied "I"m just simulating the stress teachers face every day" all while wearing a smile.True? Yes;devious and cruel? Definitely.But he is funny.

I have heard nothing but good things, but I wasn't terribly impressed. He isn't a particularly great lecturer, and he tried to cover far too much content in the time he had. His ppt slides were way too wordy, and I think he was too worried about us thinking he was cool and being fun that he didn't end up covering much.

This man is a genius. I absolutely loved this class and I really enjoyed being in his discussion. SIGN UP FOR HIS DISCUSSION. The learn to work ratio is insanely high. It is an  "easy A," but that doesn't mean you can't learn a lot in this class. It's designed for you the student. If you want to get a lot out of this class, you can. Favorite class.

Probably one of the best teachers I have had at UIUC. It is an easy A, but you do take a lot away from the class. Try to get into his discussion section. You will love it. "Turn to the person next to you"
Dr. Z, was one of the best professor that I've had since I've been back in school.  No note taking, no lectures, total interactions during all class times.  Time flies.

Literally the nicest person in all of the University of Illinois. He is genuinely interested in the individual success of every single student he comes in contact with. I would take this class over and over again if I had the opportunity. Light work, and engaging discussion. The best professor I have experienced, bar none! "Talk about it!"
He's awesome!

Dr. Zola is honestly the best professor I have ever had. He is funny, relaxed, and knowledgable. Class is really easy and interesting if you want to teach. I highly recommend any class with Prof. Zola!

EPSY 201 is easy, especially with Zola. He cares about his students and it shows. His class is a good change of pace from typical college classes. You interact with others and even the TAs during lecture. Students are often given microphones to voice their opinion in class. It's boring, but it certainly isn't that bad.

Marches to his own drummer. Be prepared to interact with your classmates and think outside the box. Dr. Zola's main goal is to get the class to interact with each other and share ideas. He isn't too concerned with grades and you shouldn't be either. Show up, participate and you'll get an A.

First of all, easy A. Boring? Worth it? or Waste of time? I say it depends on who you are.  I personally found him engaging during lecture.  I loved how this class actually did what it taught--to do things differently. It is a great eye opener for future teachers.

Really?  I've gotta be THAT guy??  okay.  let's call a spade a spade.  He's an average professor AT BEST.  he obviously is very passionate and comes up with creative lessons, but there wasn't much content behind any lecture.  they were pointless.  and so are the group essay exams.  i've learned nothing i didn't already know.  sorry to break hearts.

I don't know what everyone's talking about... Sure the class is super easy, and he is an extremely nice and funny person, but the class is boring. He seems much more concerned with people liking him than he does with actually teaching something useful. I came out of that class with nothing of value.

Zola is literally the best professor I've had to date. Like the last rater said, he will give you an A if you show up, do your work, and smile. He'll take you out to coffee and pay b/c he wants to know everyone in the class (no joke), and is super engaging and funny. Take the class, and if you can, get Zola for your discussion section as well. :)

The best professor/instructor that I ever had in my life time. It is almost impossible to not like Prof. Zola. Do not worry about your grades. He knows that you have other things to do. As long as you do what you suppose to do, which are not tough, then A you get. TAKE IT OR YOU WILL REGRET IT.

He is an amazing professor, even though I didnt read and only went to lecture and discussions I learned more with him than I did in Psych 100. Has a different method of teaching and grading but it's very effective. Loved this class would take another class with Zola as the professor.

Doctor Zola is the best teacher on this campus. Whether you want to be a teacher or not, take this class. Get him as a discussion teacher, too. You will learn so much and get to know your classmates well. Dr. Z will always put a smile on your face. TAKE ANY OF HIS CLASSES YOU WILL NOT REGRET IT
My favorite professor thus far. I definitely recommend that you get him for discussion. He's so nice and passionate about his work, and he makes the class very laid back with easy work.

Try, try, try to get Zola as your discussion TA. he takes you out for coffee/brings you donuts nearly every week, and discussion is never boring. plus you get to know your discussion classmates really well.
He is an amazing teacher. Definitely worth taking this class. One of the best decisions I have made.

Definitely a class worth taking. His lectures are pretty interesting, and you can tell that he is just so passionate about what he does that it makes you want to be there! The class itself is pretty easy...the midterms are group essays so you don't even really need to study. It all depends on what TA you get.
His class was easily the best I have taken at the university. He is a truly great teacher who genuinely cares about everyong. Teaching is his life, and he was made me want it to be mine.

such a great guy, genuine who loves his students. even if you aren't interested in education, i would still recomend this class to everyone because you learn so much about yourself as well as how people acquire information, which is helpful in any field. :)
Amazing teacher.  Excellent lectures.

I think I can safely say that Dr. Zola is THE BEST PROFESSOR ON CAMPUS!  He is such a great guy and he has a genuine interest in his students as people and future teachers.  The class is ridiculously easy, but you still learn a lot.  If you can, take a class with Dr. Zola, you'll be a better person afterward.

He is THE BEST professor ever!! I never fell in a sleep during a lecture, and discussion. The class is so interesting, and fun! The exams are group essays, and there are many little things to do, but it's definitely worth taking the class!
Best class ever! This is the only class I never fall asleep in. Try to get Dr. Zola for discussion, you'll learn alot from him. He's a really friendly guy and easy to talk to.

Best teacher ever! I had him in a "Freshman Discovery Course" as a teacher and he brought breakfast every week! He's a little unorganized, but amazing. Lectures are fun and I actually look forward to going. He grades super easy too. TAKE HIS CLASS!!
Great professor and great guy

Excellent at keeping interest during lecture.  I still remember concepts he taught us and I took his class seven years ago.  Ex. he had actual children come in and let them play/expereiment so we could see how various age groups think.  He also came dressed as Piaget once and wore a backpack (to show us all the baggage that kids have.
Incredible teacher!
Great professor! Makes every class fun and interesting. We got to watch clips from Ferris Beuller, Dangerous Minds, and Chris Farley on SNL. He was awesome. Also, class was fairly easy.

Funny, intriguing teacher.  Really interesting, informative, and fun.  Lectures incorporated all sorts of different media, like video clips adn songs.  This course seemed to be based more for teachers of younger students rather than high school students, however.
Very funny and friendly guy! This is a great and pretty easy class.
He was a great teacher.. very helpful and applied everything we learned to real life.
AMAZING TEACHER!  Cares about his students and teachers in exciting ways!  Brings breakfast to discussions! :)
He is a great teacher.  He is always looking out for his students.  He wants us to have a "family" here.
He really cares about his students and will do almost anything if it means that you will learn something in his class.  If you have the opportunity to work with him...DO IT!!!!!!!
AMAZING MAN! Dying to learn more about wine tasting from him!
k
Awesome class.  Lots of talking and discussion.  Super interesting and the most unique, interactive, and entertaining lecture I have ever had.
This professor is one of the best professors at U of I. He uses best practices at the college level which is fascinating and fun. His TAs were fun too.
A+++ excellent class & an amazing man!
Great class, terrific professor.  Not just for Ed or Psy people either.  Best class I had.

Zola truly cares about every single student.  He wants to help us become influential and inspiring teachers by modeling these qualities.  He's hilarious and wants to actually teach--not lecture.  One of the greatest profs I've ever had.  He only encourages me more so to become a teacher.

Great Professor!  He is so nice and interesting to talk to, and he will take you out for coffee.  You will have fun in lecture and to meet Piaget!  The bad part is the two hour discussions that get really boring because the TA's arn't as fun as Dr. Zola.  If you can get into his discussion DO IT!
Lecture with Zola rocks.  It's the 2 hours discussion section that will kill you.
He is awesome and made me change the way I think about children and education!!
i loved dr. zola's class-- it really changed my ideas about teaching.
fun class.  looked forward to lectures.  easy group exams.  made me look forward to teaching.
Wonderful Prof. who really cares about his students and the subject he teaches.  One of my best prof.s
Best Professor I have ever had!
The class was always interesting and we were forced to be on our toes.  Interesting examples and experiments during lectures!!  Easy group essay format Midterm and Final.  Great Teacher
WOW -- a class that teaches teachers done by the best in the business!
Terrific professor, terrific person!
Great sense of humor, understandable lessons and assignments.  The best professor I had in 5 years.
No Comments
An excellent professor.
AWESOME PROF!!!
